title: EMILY's List Rise of Women in American Politics J Batchelor.wav
description:
When Women Win: EMILY's List and the Rise of Women in American Politics by Ellen R. Malcolm and Craig Unger

John Batchelor April 16, 2016

04-16-2016 (Photo: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi of Calif., front row, center, poses with other female House members on the steps of the House on Capitol Hill in Washington, Jan. 3, 2013, prior to the official opening of the 113th Congress. Cliff Owen/AP) http://JohnBatchelorShow.com/contact http://JohnBatchelorShow.com/schedules http://johnbatchelorshow.com/blog Twitter: @BatchelorShow When Women Win: EMILY's List and the Rise of Women in American Politics. Ellen R. Malcolm & Craig Unger @emilyslistWhen Women Win: EMILY's List and the Rise of Women in American Politics by Ellen R. Malcolm and Craig Unger. "Malcolm, the founder of EMILYâ€™s List, delivers a lively, fast-paced history of the influential political action committee that helps elect pro-choice, Democratic women. Drawing on interviews with Hillary Clinton, Nancy Pelosi, Elizabeth Warren, and others, she highlights the organizationâ€™s impact on elections over the past 30 years, most notably by giving selected candidates donations early in their campaigns (EMILY is an acronym for â€œearly money is like yeastâ€). The book covers EMILYâ€™s Listâ€™s evolution, since its 1985 founding, from a fund-raising organization to a â€œmulti-pronged, full-service political operationâ€ with three million members that has helped elect 110 Democratic women to the House and 19 to the Senate, including Warren. Malcolm also emphasizes the dramatic effect of Anita Hillâ€™s testimony on the female electorate and the importance of women voters to the Democratic Party. The book shows that EMILYâ€™s Listâ€™s biggest contribution may be to make women in Congress seem so familiar that voters are now far more likely to judge women on their records and character than on their gender."â€”Publishers Weekly
